main event: Several witnesses observed an unidentified orange object in the sky near Ramore, Ontario on 30 June 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as egg-shaped and orange in color with no visible means of propulsion,, Multiple witnesses reported the sighting, including airmen who were present at a Radar Station,, The object was hovering and then disappeared suddenly,, The object was viewed for approximately 30 minutes by several citizens,, Initial thoughts suggested it might be the moon, but descriptions did not match typical lunar characteristics.
witness description: military personnel and civilians from the area
